options.text: To become a well-respected scholar of Islamic law

options.label: B
options.text: To experience divine love and reunite his soul with God

options.label: C
options.text: To compose poetry and participate in ecstatic dancing

options.label: D
options.text: To preach the religion of love through lectures and prose

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the collection of lyrical poems that Rumi composed while in his mystical states?

options.label: A
options.text: "Divan-i-Shams"

options.label: B
options.text: "Masnavi"

options.label: C
options.text: "The Path of Love"

options.label: D
options.text: "The Religion of Love"

multiple-choice.question: What was the theme of Rumi's poetry in his early fifties, as expressed in "Masnavi"?

options.label: A
options.text: Ecstatic expressions of divine love

options.label: B
options.text: Verses that guide others to discover divine love for themselves

options.label: C
options.text: The beauty of nature and the world around us

options.label: D
options.text: The importance of Islamic law and tradition

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the Sufi order established around Rumi's teachings after his death?

options.label: A
options.text: Mevlevi Sufi order

options.label: B
options.text: Rumi Sufi order

options.label: C
options.text: Shams Sufi order

options.label: D
options.text: Islamic Sufi order

multiple-choice.question: How did Rumi view romantic love in relation to divine love?

options.label: A
options.text: As a separate and distinct form of love

options.label: B
options.text: As an expression of divine love on a smaller scale

options.label: C
options.text: As a distraction from the pursuit of divine love

options.label: D
options.text: As a necessary step towards experiencing divine love

multiple-choice.question: What was the message that Rumi's words conveyed to his readers and admirers?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of following Islamic law and tradition

options.label: B
options.text: The power of romantic love to transform our lives

options.label: C
options.text: The universal message of love and acceptance

options.label: D
options.text: The need to flee from the world and seek solitude

multiple-choice.question: What did Rumi mean by the phrase "If you have lost heart in the Path of Love, flee to me without delay: I am a fortress invincible"?

options.label: A
options.text: That he was a source of comfort and guidance for those seeking love and spiritual growth

options.label: B
options.text: That he was a powerful and invincible leader who could protect his followers from harm

options.label: C
options.text: That he was a skilled warrior who could defeat his enemies with ease

options.label: D
options.text: That he was a wise and knowledgeable scholar who could answer all questions
